DOC.brief_title: Dose-Response Aerobic Training Post-Menopausal Women High-Risk Development Breast Cancer
DOC.criteria: Women highrisk breast cancer define one following : Cytologically confirm atypical hyperplasia Cytologically confirm LCIS BRCA1 and/or BRCA2 mutation carrier Predicted lifetime risk breast cancer > 20 % base family history ) Postmenopausal woman , define : Age > 45 menses least 2 year Age < 80 year old Weight < 205 kilogram Must negative mammogram negative breast MRI within 1 year protocol require baseline core biopsy Patients positive BRCA mutation must negative breast MRI within 1 year protocolrequired baseline core biopsy Clinical breast exam interpret benign ( suspicious cancer ) MSK Performing le 75 minute structure moderateintensity strenuousintensity exercise per week Able complete acceptable baseline CPET absence high risk ECG finding inappropriate response exercise determine investigator . Able achieve acceptable peek baseline CPET define follow criterion : achieve plateau oxygen consumption concurrent increase power output ; respiratory exchange ratio ≥ 1.10 ; attainment maximal predict heart rate ( HRmax ) ( i.e. , within 10 bpm agepredicted [ HRmax = 220Age [ year ] ) volitional exhaustion , measure rating perceive exertion ( RPE ) ≥ 18 BORG scale . Use selective estrogen receptor modulator aromatase inhibitor within 6 month randomization , include , limited : ( tamoxifen , raloxifene , arzoxifene , acolbifene , anastrozole , exemestane , letrozole ) Enrollment interventional investigational study Bilateral breast implant Any newly identify breast abnormality require surgical excision History following : Invasive cancer diagnosis DCIS Flat epithelial atypia Any current invasive cancer diagnosis Metastatic malignancy kind Any condition intercurrent illness opinion investigator make subject poor candidate core biopsy trial Any follow absolute contraindication cardiopulmonary exercise test and/or aerobic training : Acute myocardial Infarction ( within 35 day plan study procedure ) ; Unstable angina ; Uncontrolled arrhythmia cause symptom hemodynamic compromise ; Recurrent syncope ; Active endocarditis ; Acute myocarditis pericarditis ; Symptomatic severe aortic stenosis ; Uncontrolled heart failure ; Acute pulmonary embolus pulmonary infarction within 3 month plan study procedure ; Thrombosis low extremity ; Suspected dissect aneurysm ; Uncontrolled asthma ; Pulmonary edema ; Room air desaturation rest ≤85 % ; Respiratory failure ; Acute noncardiopulmonary disorder may affect exercise performance aggravate exercise ( i.e . infection , renal failure , thyrotoxicosis ) ; Mental impairment lead inability cooperate .
